H0.text: Flow as currents through liquids is what occurs when molecules are involved in heat transfer by conduction.

H1.text: Form waves that travel through space is the process of heat transfer by conduction when molecules interact.

H2.text: Become less dense and rise is what happens when molecules undergo heat transfer by conduction.

H3.text: Collide with other molecules is what happens when heat transfer by conduction occurs.

A4.text: heat is transferred by conduction when adjacent atoms vibrate against one another

A5.text: Conduction is the most significant means of heat transfer within a solid or between solid objects in thermal contact
